channel.title: Should I get a SoundCloud?
channel.description:
Hey all,
I've been producing for about a year, overall, using FL Studio and (more recently), Auxy, and I'm wondering whether I should get a SoundCloud page.
It seems like SoundCloud is what everyone around here uses. What do you guys like about it? What do you guys _not_ like about it?
\-- N

item.title: Should I get a SoundCloud?
item.dc:creator: Norfleet
item.description:
@INDIR3CT @Produk @Arimyth Okay, I’ve got one. Somebody else has already taken the username “norfleet” so I tried “norfleetmusic”. That’s okay, right?

https://soundcloud.com/norfleetmusic

I’ve also posted my first track on there! It’s not Auxy (so I didn’t make a thread about it), but I hope you will check it out.

Read full topic

item.title: Should I get a SoundCloud?
item.dc:creator: Arimyth
item.description:
Out of the three main music distribution platforms (SoundCloud, Spotify, iTunes) SoundCloud is probably the most “accessible” for a smaller producer while still having a very large user base.

Definitely post a couple of your tracks there if you’re interested in community feedback and possibly moving towards monetization in the future.

As a side note, I also like having my finished tracks on SoundCloud because it allows me to add them to playlists and listen to them along with tracks from other producers.

Read full topic

item.title: Should I get a SoundCloud?
item.dc:creator: Produk
item.description:
Great for distribution + exposure, if you actively promote yourself in the beginning.

Fun way to get feedback on music and get your name brand out there.

Also is like the gateway drug to Spotify and iTunes imo

Read full topic

item.title: Should I get a SoundCloud?
item.dc:creator: INDIR3CT
item.description:
Hello there!

Soundcloud is a simple way to post tracks and get feedback. I definitely recommend putting some tracks on there. Of course, It isn’t top of the line music distribution, like Itunes, Spotify, etc. But it can definitely help showcase your work.

(Its also free )

Read full topic
